qa_list.question: What are the days and times of Shakespeare's courses?
qa_list.answer: Shakespeare offers courses on Monday, Wednesday, Friday (MWF), Tuesday, Thursday (TR), and Saturday (S). The specific class hours vary for each course: Tragedies & Histories is from 12:30 PM to 01:50 PM; Exploring Creative Writing in Community is from 02:30 PM to 05:10 PM; Arts Greenhouse: Experiential Learning through Community Engagement is from 11:00 AM to 12:20 PM; Introduction to Writing Fiction is also from 12:30 PM to 01:50 PM; Introduction to Writing Poetry and Introduction to Screenwriting are both from 09:30 AM to 10:50 AM; Introduction to Writing for the Professions has three different sections with varying class hours (Monday, Wednesday, Friday from 09:00 AM to 09:50 AM in PH A19A, Monday, Tuesday, Thursday from 08:00 AM to 08:50 AM and 12:00 PM to 12:50 PM respectively in the same location; Writing for the Professions for SCS students has two sections with varying class hours (Monday, Wednesday, Friday from 11:00 AM to 11:50 AM in WEH 6423 and Monday, Tuesday, Thursday from 10:00 AM to 10:50 AM respectively; Writing for the Professions for Data Science Students is on Monday and Friday from 09:30 AM to 10:50 AM in PH A20A).

qa_list.answer: The class list includes TBA 76773, Argument on Monday at 12:30 PM - 01:50 PM; WEH 4708, Coulson on Wednesday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; WEH 5202, Software Documentation on Wednesday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; WEH 5328, Style on Tuesday at 9:30 AM - 10:50 AM; WEH 5328, Style on Thursday at 9:30 AM - 10:50 AM; PH 125D, Science Writing on Friday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; PH 125D, Directed Research in Rhetoric on Monday and Wednesday from 9:30 AM - 12:30 PM; DNM, Coulson B on Tuesday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; DNM, Larson C on Thursday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; PH A19C, Directed Study in Literary and Cultural Studies on Monday from 9:30 AM - 12:30 PM; PH A19C, Directed Study II on Tuesday at 7:00 PM - 09:50 PM; PH 125D, Mediated Power and Propaganda on Tuesday at 12:30 PM - 01:50 PM; PH A19C, Rhetoric and the Body on Thursday at 9:30 AM - 10:50 AM; PH 125D, Theory and Design of Writing Instruction on Monday from 2:00 PM - 4:20 PM; PH 125C, Introduction to Digital Humanities on Tuesday at 9:30 AM - 10:50 AM; BH 255B, Issues in the Discipline on Monday from 4:00 PM - 6:50 PM; BH 255B, Black Lives in Pre-1900 Britain on Monday at 12:30 PM - 01:50 PM; WEH 4707, Refugee Stories: Literature, Art and Film on Tuesday from 2:00 PM - 4:50 PM.

qa_list.question: What are the names of the instructors teaching each class?
qa_list.answer: The instructors for each class are Coulson (76773), Houser (76790), Idzik (76795), Linn (76800), Larson B (76801), Newman B (76802), Oddo (76815), Larson (76818, 76824), Warren (76836), Makonnen (76842), Klancher (76858), Aguiar (76861).

qa_list.question: What is the subject of class 76800?
qa_list.answer: The subject of class 76800 is Style.

qa_list.question: When and where does class 76815 take place?
qa_list.answer: Class 76815, Mediated Power and Propaganda, takes place on Tuesdays at 12:30 PM - 01:50 PM in PH 125C.

qa_list.question: What is the subject of class 76842?
qa_list.answer: The subject of class 76842 is Theory and Design of Writing Instruction.

qa_list.question: Who teaches class 76818, Rhetoric and the Body?
qa_list.answer: Class 76818, Rhetoric and the Body, is taught by Larson.

qa_list.question: What are the subjects of classes 76824 and 76858?
qa_list.answer: The subject of class 7682'
